Generation IV.Diamond: It agilely scales sheer cliffs to live atop craggy mountains. Its fire is put out when it sleeps.
Generation IV.Pearl: Its fiery rear end is fueled by gas made in its belly. Even rain can't extinguish the fire.
Generation IV.Platinum: It is very agile. Before going to sleep, it extinguishes the flame on its tail to prevent fires.
Generation IV.HeartGold: The gas made in its belly burns from its rear end. The fire burns weakly when it feels sick.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: The gas made in its belly burns from its rear end. The fire burns weakly when it feels sick.

Generation V.Black: It is very agile. Before going to sleep, it extinguishes the flame on its tail to prevent fires.
Generation V.White: It is very agile. Before going to sleep, it extinguishes the flame on its tail to prevent fires.
Generation V.Black 2: It is very agile. Before going to sleep, it extinguishes the flame on its tail to prevent fires.
Generation V.White 2: It is very agile. Before going to sleep, it extinguishes the flame on its tail to prevent fires.

Generation VI.X: Its fiery rear end is fueled by gas made in its belly. Even rain can't extinguish the fire.
Generation VI.Y: The gas made in its belly burns from its rear end. The fire burns weakly when it feels sick.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Its fiery rear end is fueled by gas made in its belly. Even rain can't extinguish the fire.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: The gas made in its belly burns from its rear end. The fire burns weakly when it feels sick.

Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: It agilely scales sheer cliffs to live atop craggy mountains. Its fire is put out when it sleeps.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: Its fiery rear end is fueled by gas made in its belly. Even rain can't extinguish the fire.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: Full of vigor and always in high spirits. It was once known by the name "Lantern-Tail" and feared as some kind of apparition.

Generation IX.Scarlet: It is very agile. Before going to sleep, it extinguishes the flame on its tail to prevent fires.
Generation IX.Violet: The gas made in its belly burns from its rear end. The fire burns weakly when it feels sick.

Generation IV.Diamond: First partner Pokémon from Professor Rowan 's briefcase at Lake Verity
Generation IV.Pearl: First partner Pokémon from Professor Rowan 's briefcase at Lake Verity
Generation IV.Platinum: First partner Pokémon from Professor Rowan 's briefcase on Route 201

Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Received from Professor Birch on Route 101 after entering the Hall of Fame twice
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Received from Professor Birch on Route 101 after entering the Hall of Fame twice

Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: First partner Pokémon from Professor Rowan 's briefcase at Lake Verity Grand Underground - Sandsear Cave , Typhlo Cavern , Volcanic Cave (after obtaining the National Pokédex )
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: First partner Pokémon from Professor Rowan 's briefcase at Lake Verity Grand Underground - Sandsear Cave , Typhlo Cavern , Volcanic Cave (after obtaining the National Pokédex )
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: Obsidian Fieldlands : Deertrack Heights , Windswept Run (only one during Request 20), Ramanas Island , massive mass outbreaks

Generation IX.The Hidden Treasure of Area Zero: Received as an Egg from Jacq on Reveler's Road (random between Turtwig, Chimchar and Piplup) Chargestone Cavern , Polar Biome (after boosting biodiversity in the Polar Biome)
